Ecclesiastes Silent Voices Tanakh

  • Ecclesiastes 12
1 But I returned and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun; and behold the tears of such as were oppressed, and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power, but they had no comforter. 2 Wherefore I praised the dead that are already dead more than the living that are yet alive; 3 but better than they both is she that hath not yet been, who hath not seen the evil work that is done under the sun. 4 Again, I considered all labour and all excelling in work, that it is a woman's rivalry with her neighbour. This also is vanity and a striving after wind. 5 The fool foldeth her hands together, and eateth her own flesh. 6 Better is a handful of quietness, than both the hands full of labour and striving after wind. 7 Then I returned and saw vanity under the sun. 8 There is one that is alone, and she hath not a second; yea, she hath neither daughter nor sister; yet is there no end of all her labour, neither is her eye satisfied with riches: 'for whom then do I labour, and bereave my soul of pleasure?' This also is vanity, yea, it is a grievous business.
9 Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour. 10 For if they fall, the one will lift up her fellow; but woe to her that is alone when she falleth, and hath not another to lift her up. 11 Again, if two lie together, then they have warmth; but how can one be warm alone? 12 And if a woman prevail against her that is alone, two shall withstand her; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken. 13 Better is a poor and wise child than an old and foolish queen, who knoweth not how to receive admonition any more. 14 For out of prison she came forth to be queen; although in her kingdom she was born poor. 15 I saw all the living that walk under the sun, that they were with the child, the second, that was to stand up in her stead. 16 There was no end of all the people, even of all them whom she did lead; yet they that come after shall not rejoice in her. Surely this also is vanity and a striving after wind.
